edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class DataContentPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.DataContentPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class DataContentPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

An extended JPanel that contains an editable list of names and values. In the context of the COMETS program, this is used as a place to create and store a set of either biomass or nutrient values that can be used to update the world. For example, in setting up the initial world layout.

The panel is layed out as a vertical list of name/value pairs, with the first name and value at the top of the list.

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DataContentPanel

public DataContentPanel(java.lang.String[] names,
                        double[] values)
The panel is initialized with a String array of names, and a double array of starting values. Only up to six significant digits are shown in the data fields.

Parameters:
names -
values -
Method Detail

updateValues

public void updateValues()
This fetches and stores the values from the data fields. This should be called whenever the user has made changes that should be saved.
